revisions.rev:
{{Infobox person | name = Matthew McConaughey | image = Matthew McConaughey 2011 AA.jpg | imagesize = | caption = McConaughey at the [[83rd Academy Awards]] in 2011 | birth_date = {{birth date and age|mf=yes|1969|11|4}} | birth_name = Matthew David McConaughey | birth_place = [[Uvalde, Texas|Uvalde]], Texas, US | domesticpartner = [[Camila Alves]] (2007âpresent; 2 children) | occupation = Actor | yearsactive = 1991âpresent }}
'''Matthew David McConaughey''' ({{IPAc-en|icon|m|É|Ë|k|É|n|É|h|eÉª}};<ref>[http://www.loc.gov/nls/other/sayhow.html#m Say How? A Pronunciation Guide to Names of Public Figures], [[Library of Congress]]</ref> born November 4, 1969) is an American actor.
After a series of minor roles in the early 1990s, McConaughey gained notice for his breakout role in ''[[Dazed and Confused]]'' (1993). He then appeared in films such as ''[[A Time to Kill (film)|A Time to Kill]]'', ''[[Contact (film)|Contact]]'', ''[[U-571 (film)|U-571]]'', ''[[Tiptoes]]'', ''[[Sahara (2005 film)|Sahara]]'', and ''[[We Are Marshall]]''. McConaughey is best known more recently for his performances as a leading man in the romantic comedies ''[[The Wedding Planner]]'', ''[[How to Lose a Guy in 10 Days]]'', ''[[Failure to Launch]]'', ''[[Ghosts of Girlfriends Past]]'' and [[Fool's Gold (2008 film)|''Fool's Gold'']].
==Early life== McConaughey, the youngest of three boys, was born in [[Uvalde, Texas|Uvalde]], Texas. His mother, Mary Kathleen "Kay" (nÃ©e McCabe), was a kindergarten teacher, and his father, James Donald McConaughey, was a gas-station owner who ran an oil pipe supply business and once played [[American football|football]] for the [[Green Bay Packers]].<ref>http://www.databasefootball.com/teams/teamyear.htm?tm=GNB&yr=1953&lg=nfl</ref><ref>http://www.the-kramerfamily.com/1953PACKERS.html</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.filmreference.com/film/66/Matthew-McConaughey.html |title=Matthew McConaughey Biography (1969â) |publisher=Filmreference.com |date= |accessdate=October 16, 2009}}</ref> McConaughey has Irish ancestry<ref name="Irish">{{cite web | title=Metro.co.uk| work=60 Second interview: Matthew McConaughey | url=http://www.metro.co.uk/fame/interviews/article.html?in_article_id=11644&in_page_id=11 | accessdate =May 7, 2006}}</ref> and had a [[Methodist]] upbringing.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nzherald.co.nz/movies/news/article.cfm?c_id=200&objectid=188381 |title=No use putting out the welcome Matt â Movies â NZ Herald News |publisher=Nzherald.co.nz |date=May 12, 2001 |accessdate=August 5, 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://google.com/search?q=cache:BXh-tdOKKIMJ:www.cinema.com/articles/62/wedding-planner-the-interview-with-matthew-mcconaughey.phtml+%22Wedding+Planner,+The+:+Interview+With+Matthew+McConaughey%22&cd=1&hl=en&ct=clnk |title=Wedding Planner, The : Interview With Matthew McConaughey |publisher=google.com |date= |accessdate=August 5, 2010}}</ref><ref name="upbringing">{{cite news | title=Find Articles | work=Matthew's interview â Matthew McConaughey â Interview | url=http://www.findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_m1285/is_n8_v26/ai_18777626 | accessdate =April 15, 2006}} {{Dead link|date=August 2010|bot=RjwilmsiBot}}</ref> McConaughey's mother and late father divorced and re-married each other several times.<ref name="marriage">{{cite web | title=ABC7news.com | work=Barbara Walters' Oscar Special | url=http://abclocal.go.com/kgo/story?section=entertainment&id=3949579 | accessdate =April 15, 2006}}</ref>
McConaughey moved to [[Longview, Texas|Longview]], Texasâ located east of Dallas, where he attended Longview High School. While in high school, he was voted most handsome in the Longview Lobo Yearbook. He lived for a year in [[Warnervale, New South Wales]], Australia, as a [[Rotary International|Rotary]] [[Rotary Youth Exchange|exchange student]] in 1988.<ref name="exchange">{{cite web | title=ONE news | work=McConaughey credits Australian town | url=http://tvnz.co.nz/view/page/425826/696966 | accessdate =December 22, 2006}}</ref> McConaughey attended the [[University of Texas at Austin College of Communication|College of Communication]] at the [[University of Texas at Austin]], where he joined [[Delta Tau Delta|Delta Tau Delta International Fraternity]] and lived at The Castilian residence hall.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.studenthousingplanet.com/2009/03/the-castilian-dorm-serving-the-university-of-texas-receives-upgrades-prcom.html |title=The Castilian Dorm Serving the University of Texas Receives Upgrades (PR.com) |publisher=Student Housing Planet |date=March 26, 2009 |accessdate=October 16, 2009}}</ref> He began in fall of 1989 and graduated in the spring of 1993 with a B.S. degree in Radio-Television-Film.<ref>http://utdirect.utexas.edu/registrar/degv.WBX Degrees and Dates of Attendance: MCCONAUGHEY, MATTHEW D.] â website of the University of Texas at Austin</ref>
==Career== McConaughey began his acting career in 1991, appearing in television commercials, before being cast in [[Richard Linklater|Richard Linklater's]] film ''[[Dazed and Confused]]'', which became a critical success, garnering largely positive reviews.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/dazed_and_confused/ |title=Dazed and Confused Movie Reviews, Pictures |publisher=Rotten Tomatoes |date= |accessdate=August 5, 2010}}</ref> After appearing in some smaller roles in ''[[Angels in the Outfield (1994 film)|Angels in the Outfield]],'' ''[[Texas Chainsaw Massacre: The Next Generation]]'', ''[[Boys on the Side]]'', the television series ''[[Unsolved Mysteries]]'', and as the male lead in the ''[[Trisha Yearwood]]'' music video for the song ''[[Walkaway Joe]]'', McConaughey's big break came as the lawyer "Jake Brigance" in the 1996 film ''[[A Time to Kill (film)|A Time to Kill]]'', based on the [[John Grisham]] novel of the [[A Time to Kill|same name]].{{Citation needed|date=March 2009}}
McConaughey was cast in leading roles in many more movies: ''[[Contact (film)|Contact]]'', ''[[Amistad (1997 film)|Amistad]]'', ''[[The Newton Boys]]'', ''[[EDtv]]'', and ''[[U-571 (film)|U-571]]''. By the early 2000s, he was frequently cast in [[romantic comedy|romantic comedies]], including ''[[The Wedding Planner]]'' and ''[[How to Lose a Guy in 10 Days]]'', both of which were successful at the box office. During this period, he appeared as a firefighter in the low-budget film ''Tiptoes'', opposite [[Rene Russo]], in ''[[Two For The Money]]'' as a protege to [[Al Pacino]]'s gambling mogul, and in ''[[Frailty]]'', cast against type as a [[serial killer]], opposite [[Bill Paxton]]. On September 10, 2000, he appears as himself on the show ''[[Sex and the City]]'' on [[HBO]], talking with [[Carrie Bradshaw]] (played by [[Sarah Jessica Parker]]) about optioning her columns to make a movie.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Sex_and_the_City_episodes |title=List of Sex and the City episodes â Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia |publisher=En.wikipedia.org |date= |accessdate=August 5, 2010}}</ref>
McConaughey starred in the feature film ''[[Sahara (2005 film)|Sahara]]'', along with [[Steve Zahn]] and [[PenÃ©lope Cruz]]. Prior to the release of the movie, he promoted it by repeating some trips he took in the late 1990s, including sailing down the [[Amazon River]] and trekking to [[Mali]].{{Citation needed|date=March 2009}} That same year, McConaughey was named [[People (magazine)|''People'']] magazine's âSexiest Man Aliveâ for 2005.<ref>People magazine: [http://www.people.com/people/package/custom/0,,1113899,00.html "2005 Sexiest Man of the Year"] Retrieved May 19, 2008.</ref>
In 2006, he co-starred with [[Sarah Jessica Parker]] in the romantic comedy ''[[Failure to Launch]]'', which was reasonably successful at the box office. McConaughey also provided voice work for an ad campaign of the [[Peace Corps]] in late 2006. Matthew's production company, j.k. livin, is currently in development on projects with [[Warner Bros.]], [[Universal Studios|Universal]], [[Paramount Pictures]] and [[Imagine Entertainment]]. McConaughey starred in the football drama ''[[We Are Marshall]]''. He also appeared in [[Ben Stiller]]'s ''[[Tropic Thunder]]'', replacing [[Owen Wilson]] after Wilson's suicide attempt.<ref>[http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20057720,00.html Matthew McConaughey to Replace Owen Wilson in Film]</ref>
On January 21, 2008, McConaughey became the new spokesman for the national radio campaign, [[National Cattlemen's Beef Association|"Beef: It's What's For Dinner"]], replacing actor [[Sam Elliot]].<ref>{{cite press release |title= âBeef. Itâs Whatâs For Dinnerâ Advertising Campaign Invites Consumers to Discover the Power of Protein |publisher= National Cattlemenâs Beef Association |date= January 7, 2008 |url= http://www.beefitswhatsfordinner.com/askexpert/pressrelease.asp |accessdate=July 2, 2008}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last= Shinn |first= Peter |title= Iowa beef producers talk ethanol, checkoff, ID and more |publisher= Learfield Communications, Inc. |date= January 8, 2008 |url= http://www.brownfieldnetwork.com/gestalt/go.cfm?objectid=5B485CD1-D82F-1E37-97BEE903CA6A298D |accessdate=July 2, 2008}} {{Dead link|date=September 2010|bot=H3llBot}}</ref>
In June 2010 it was announced that McConaughey is teaming up with [[Marc Hyman]] to develop a scripted comedy for TV channel [[FX (TV channel)|FX]] based on material from J. R. Reed.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tvguide.com/News/Matthew-McConaughey-FX-1019308.aspx|title=Matthew McConaughey Teams Up With FX For Scripted Comedy|publisher=TVGuide.com}}</ref>
McConaughey was one of the presenters at the 2011 Academy Awards ceremony.
==Personal life== [[File:Matthew McConaughey.jpg|thumb|right|McConaughey approaching the finish line in a triathlon, September 2008.]] McConaughey is an avid fan of the [[Texas Longhorns]] and the [[Washington Redskins]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://sportsillustrated.cnn.com/2005/writers/richard_deitsch/09/29/qa.mcconaughey/index.html|title=Q&A: Matthew McConaughey|date=September 29, 2005|accessdate=May 5, 2009 | work=CNN}}</ref>
McConaughey's personal motto is "Just Keep Livin". His foundation is called j.k. livin foundation (all lower-case), which "is dedicated to helping teenage kids lead active lives and make healthy choices to become great men and women."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.matthewmcconaughey.com/ |title=j.k. livin |publisher=Matthew McConaughey |date= |accessdate=August 5, 2010}}</ref>
===Arrest=== On October 26, 1999, McConaughey was arrested in [[Austin]], Texas, for [[resisting arrest]] following a disturbance in the early hours of the morning and for possession of [[Cannabis (drug)|cannabis]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/entertainment/486051.stm |title=Entertainment | Actor McConaughey arrested |publisher=BBC News |date=October 26, 1999 |accessdate=October 16, 2009}}</ref> He had been found to be playing music very loudly on [[bongo drum]]s while [[nudity|nude]] in his own home.<ref>{{cite news|last=Bakker |first=Tiffany |url=http://www.news.com.au/dailytelegraph/story/0,22049,25346513-5006011,00.html |title=McConaughey's reel life | The Daily Telegraph |publisher=News.com.au |date=April 19, 2009 |accessdate=October 16, 2009}}</ref> McConaughey denied the drug charges (which were subsequently dropped),<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/films/features/matthew-mcconaughey-headbutting-stars-and-naked-bongos-639678.html |title=Matthew McConaughey: Headbutting stars and naked bongos â Features, Films |publisher=The Independent |date=August 11, 2002 |accessdate=October 16, 2009 | location=London | first=Demetrios | last=Matheou}}</ref> but was charged with disturbing the peace. He pled guilty and paid a fine of $50.
===Animal rescue=== McConaughey rescued various pets stranded after the flooding of New Orleans from [[Hurricane Katrina]].<ref>Toronto Fashion Monitor: [http://toronto.fashion-monitor.com/news.php/toronto_celebrities/2005091203Matthew_McConaughey "Matthew McConaughey Saves the Pets."]. Retrieved March 25, 2007.</ref> In 2006, in [[Sherman Oaks, California|Sherman Oaks]], California, he rescued a cat from two youths who had doused the animal in hairspray and were attempting to set it on fire.<ref>''[[San Francisco Chronicle]]'': [http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/blogs/dailydish/detail?blogid=7&entry_id=4506 "McConaughey in Cat Rescue."]. Retrieved March 25, 2007.</ref>
===Family=== [[File:McConaugheyAlves2010-Crop.jpg|thumb|right|McConaughey with partner [[Camila Alves]] in 2010.]] McConaughey met his partner, Brazilian model and television performer [[Camila Alves]], in 2006, and they are currently living in [[Austin, Texas|Austin]], Texas. Together they have two children, son Levi Alves McConaughey (born 2008), and daughter Vida Alves McConaughey (born 2010).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.people.com/people/article/0,,20333981,00.html|title=Matthew McConaughey, Camila Alves Welcome Daughter Vida|publisher=People.com|accessdate=3 January 2010}}</ref>
